description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to achieve enhanced transparency and efficiency in the management of public finances andimproved governance and efficiency in the cocoa sector.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Economy and Finance - Don de Gouvernance et de Developpement Institutionnel (DGDI)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section V | Description :Set up an upgraded Project Financial Management Information System to replace thecurrent system (SUCCESS) which has limited functionalities with regard to reporting, monitoring, and procurement. | Due Date:01-Oct-2014
Finance Agreement :Section V | Description :Update the Procedure Manual particularly regarding the sections on missions and bankarrangements | Due Date :01-Oct-2014

title.narrative: New contracts are subject to new terms and conditions of the new regulatory framework

target.value: Full application of the new hydrocarbon code

actual.value: Achieved. New contracts are awarded according to the new hydrocarbon code.

title.narrative: Percentage of parafiscal levies executed in the budget
Rate of integrated capacity building plan execution (%)
Integrity and transparency of the procurement process (OECD/DAC methodology)
The number of communes connected to the SIGFIP

actual.value: 57 communes of which 15 were connected by DGDI

title.narrative: Value of parafiscal levies in the cocoa sector
Rate of transposition of WAEMU guidelines and international standards in the national procurement regulatory framework (%)
Rate of integrated plan execution (% of budget expenditures captured by SIGFIP

baseline.value: 86 percent in 2008 (2207 data has been requested)

title.narrative: Standard deviation of data provided by the One-Stop shop, the Bourse du café et du cacao (BCC) and the Customs
Environmental management information system is in place

baseline.value: No Environment Management Plan (EMP) in place

title.narrative: Percentage of non-complaince cases resolved in a reasonable timeframe is measured and used as benchmark for monitoring regulatory efficiency.

target.value: All non-compliance cases resolved in a reasonable timeframe in 2012

title.narrative: Procedures for the transparent licensing of petroleum rights in line with good industry practice are in place

target.value: Transparent procedures are adopted and implemented.

actual.value: Not completely achieved as originally planned.

title.narrative: The first EITI report is published

target.value: Achievement of the validation status in 2010
Updated websites have been completed and made operational

title.narrative: Flexible and efficient fiscal system for upstream petroleum sector is adopted

baseline.value: No revision of the fiscal system initiated

target.value: New fiscal system for upstream Petroleum adopted

baseline.value: No revision of the regulatory framework initiated in 2008

title.narrative: Petroleum revenue forecast and variance analysis are carried out periodically (monthly, quarterly, and yearly)

baseline.value: No tools for revenue forecast and analysis are in place

target.value: New tools are adopted and implemented

title.narrative: Amended/new legal, regulatory and contractual framework is updated and adopted

target.value: New legal, regulatory and contractual framework is adopted

title.narrative: Access of public to principal budget information

actual.value: B as evaluated by the Project M&E specialist and the Ministry of Budget staff. Financial information is regularly made availableonline via the Ministry of Finance's website. It includes: (i) the annual budget; (ii) Year-end financial execution statements;(iii) procurement contract awards; and (iv) quarterly budget execution performance. This PDO indicator applied only to the originalproject. It was included in the Additional Financing. Still, it is worth mentioning the positive evolution.

title.narrative: Composition of real expenditure accordingly to the initial approved budget
Organized and participatory process of budget preparation
Competition, value for money and controls in procurement
Multi-year perspective in the budget planning and public expenditure policy
Cocoa Cooperatives registered with CCC that publish their accounts
Average transfer time for DGI documents received at the registry to the Treasury

actual.value: B as evaluated by the Project M&E specialist and the Ministry of Budget staff using PEFA methodology on which they were trained andare certified. More than 14 internal audits and 10 internal control missions have been conducted. The capacity of all the controland audit bodies including Chamber of Account (Supreme Audit Institution), the State General Inspection, and the Financial GeneralInspection has been significantly strengthened by the Project through training (risk-based audit) and acquisition of equipment.Audit reports are regularly produce; their quality has greatly improved; and a good number corrective measures have been taken.However, they are not yet widely publicized and made accessible to general audience.

title.narrative: PI-20 Effectiveness of internal controls for non-salary expenditure

actual.value: C as evaluated by the Project M&E specialist and the Ministry of Budget staff following the PEFA methodology on which they weretrained and are certified. Purchase order and other non-salary expenditures are regularly monitored and generally within allocatedbudgets. Capacity building and technical provided on expenditure control have helped increase the frequency of control and accountsregulations.

title.narrative: Cocoa Cooperatives registered with CCC that obtain buyer or selling certificate by CCC
Internal audits carried out by harmonized core team
Internal controls carried out by harmonized core team
Average transfer time for transfer of DGD documents received at the registry to the Treasury
Average decentralized budget execution through SIGESCOD
Share of Government transfers to EPNs and internally generated funds executed though RICI-EPN
